metadata.title: CVE-2017-11104 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Knot DNS before 2.4.5 and 2.5.x before 2.5.2 contains a flaw within the TSIG protocol implementation that would allow an attacker with a valid key name and algorithm to bypass TSIG authentication if no additional ACL restrictions are set, because of an improper TSIG validity period check.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-11104` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

knot - 2.6.5-3
knot-dnsutils - 2.6.5-3
knot-host - 2.6.5-3
knot-module-dnstap - 2.6.5-3
knot-module-geoip - 2.6.5-3
libdnssec8 - 2.6.5-3
libknot11 - 2.6.5-3
libzscanner3 - 2.6.5-3
python3-libknot - 2.6.5-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: knot package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.5-3').
